args:
When Patia hears the imperials attacked the
beach after being forced to work without rest,
she feels great sympathy for their position.
She and Mikoto then enact a plan to help the
soldiers while also protecting the beach.
Ha! You never had a chance!

Those who pursue violence without reason
stand in opposition to the will of Heaven.
My bow will remove your blight from this
beach and make it pristine once more.
Taste the justice of Heaven! Evil will fall,\nand this beach will ever remain free!
The losses you've suffered have sapped\nyour will to fight. If you take flight now,\nwe will not pursue you.
We want our vacation, and we'll do\nwhatever it takes to make it happen!
A shame. Even the wildest of beasts know\ndiscretion is the better part of valor.
Yeah, but WE'VE got the power of the\nhuman spirit, and we won't give up at\nthe first sign of a setback!
Why must you be so tenacious? Do you\ntruly resent innocent vacationers so?
How would you feel if your own leave\nwas interrupted in such a fashion?
When we joined the army, we thought our\nhard work would be rewarded in kind.

Instead, our commanders just send us on
one mission after another! And while
the objectives pile up, the time we have
to get 'em done only shrinks!

Our task lists all blend into each other
and the missions never end. Frankly,
we're all miserable—and it's the same
story up and down the Empire.
You know how it is: Generals do the\nleading while us grunts do the bleeding.\nWe deserve at least a LITTLE happiness!
And why, exactly, are you telling us this?
Because we want a vacation, we want\nit now, and we're not gonna be denied.\nNow stand aside and let us have this!
Your pathetic whinging is no excuse\nfor violating the natural order. Patia,\nit seems we need to—

I know your pain! You're working so hard,
your leave is in sight, but just before you
pack your bags, another urgent mission
rears its ugly head!
I take it the same thing's happened to you?

Being ready for any contingency is part of
a soldier's job. Sometimes things happen
and there is no choice but to set everything
aside and act.

But when you pull a miracle out of your
hat and complete the mission, your
commander only assumes that means
he can pile ever more on your plate!

We work hard so we can buy ourselves
a break, but our commander doesn't care
because he's got the brass breathing down
his own neck.
Tyranny is what it is! We may be grunts,\nbut we've still got feelings!
Yeah, we've a right to enjoy a nice\nvacation same as anyone else!
I understand that, and I sympathize.\nYet that still does not make it permissible\nfor you to ruin the vacations of others.
When you send evil out into the world,\nit returns to you tenfold. Would you not\nagree with this, Mikoto?
Yeah, but it's still not fair!

Then instead of taking your frustrations
out on innocent civilians, go back to your
commanding officer and plead your case.
I'll even go with you, if you like.
Yes. But in exchange, you must agree\nto fully withdraw from this beach.
Pray forgive me for ruining the mood,\nbut this plan makes precious little sense.
Shut it, ya weirdo! Us and the lady\ngot an agreement going here!
And yet, you have already shattered the\ntranquility of this beach. There can be no\nabsolution without first addressing the sin.

To say nothing of the fact that Patia serves
the leader of the New Alberian Army.
Do you not fear the consequences of
conspiring with your sworn enemies?
Er, I suppose I didn't consider\nthat part of it, exactly...
Indeed, were this a different situation,\nall of you would likely be meeting each\nother at the end of a sword.
I THOUGHT I knew that face! You're from\nthe White Sparrow Corps! The ones who\nup and deserted the Empire!
Cor, you're right! She's the Vice Captain!\nThe one with a spine of pure steel!
Argh! Damn it all, Mikoto is right!\nI'm sorry, but I can't in good conscience\ncollaborate with you on this.
Now please just leave this beach!
It appears we all understand each other.\nAway with you all, then.
Damn it, this is not over!\nWe WILL have our vacation!
They're gone. Although based on their\nattitude, I expect we will see them\nback here on the morrow.
Their resentment about being denied\na vacation runs deep, and their passion\nregarding that snub is very real.

Their hearts are an open book with
a tale of single-minded obsession—
not unlike my own heart with its
eternal pursuit of Mineuchi.

Their attack against this beach was an
affront to the natural order. Therefore,
we may conclude it Heaven's will that
we ignore the thirst within their hearts.
However, if it is Heaven's will that I seek\nto fill the void within my own heart,\nthen it may be so for them as well.
This all boils down to one thing:\nVacations are awesome.
There must be some way to let them have\ntheir dream vacation without disrupting\nthe happiness of everyone else.
*sigh* I suppose I must report back\nto His Highness about what has\ntranspired here today.
I just wish there was something\nwe could actually DO...
You certainly seem to be in higher\nspirits than you were yesterday.
That's because I figured out a solution\nthat will satisfy everyone!
That's great, Patia. What is it?
Er, I think it would be faster to show you\nthan explain it—but I'm going to need\nMikoto to come with me first.
His athleticism is going to be required\nfor this little endeavor.
If you think your plan might avoid\nfurther bloodshed, I am for you.
Leave the beach in our hands, Highness,\nand we will leave the rest in yours.
Good luck, you guys! Er, with...\nwhatever it is you're doing?
